what: Customizing CV data with JSON file
title: Introduction to vitorcid
text: Sometimes one might want customize CV data. three general cases: * adding data unavailable orcid.org * overwriting data fetched orcid.org * adding data provided orcid.org

previous_headings: Use cases > Customizing CV data with JSON file
title: Introduction to vitorcid
text: Currently, two header entries can provided via JSON file: ‘position’ ‘address’. example JSON file entries defined: Sometimes, user might want update email profile picture: One can use JSON data getting latest CV following way:
code: j_path <- system.file(package = "vitorcid", "json_examples/orcid_0000-0002-7059-6378_header_data.json") jsonlite::toJSON(jsonlite::fromJSON(j_path), pretty = TRUE) #> { #>   "header_data": { #>     "position": ["Bioinformatician and R programmer"], #>     "address": ["Skierniewice, Poland"] #>   } #> } j_path <- system.file(package = "vitorcid", "json_examples/orcid_0000-0002-7059-6378_email.json") jsonlite::toJSON(jsonlite::fromJSON(j_path), pretty = TRUE) #> { #>   "header_data": { #>     "email": ["new_email@email.com"] #>   } #> }  j_path <- system.file(package = "vitorcid", "json_examples/orcid_0000-0002-7059-6378_profilepic.json") jsonlite::toJSON(jsonlite::fromJSON(j_path), pretty = TRUE) #> { #>   "header_data": { #>     "profilepic": ["https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9f/Curriculum-vitae-warning-icon.svg/240px-Curriculum-vitae-warning-icon.svg.png"] #>   } #> } vitorcid::get_cv(json_path = j_path)

previous_headings: Use cases > Customizing CV data with JSON file
title: Introduction to vitorcid
text: One able provide details specific employment education entries orcid.org. example defining details user ORCID ID: “0000-0002-7059-6378”. case four employment two education entries (see details . One can use JSON data getting latest CV following way:
code: # defining details with idx (counting from the top to the bottom) j_path <- system.file(package = "vitorcid", "json_examples/orcid_0000-0002-7059-6378_why_idx.json") jsonlite::toJSON(jsonlite::fromJSON(j_path), pretty = TRUE) #> { #>   "employment": [ #>     { #>       "idx": 1, #>       "why": "developing biomedical R packages, especially those related to Next-Generation Sequencing data__developing R/Shiny application for visualization of NGS data__developing R/Shiny application for visualization of dose-response data (technical leader)" #>     }, #>     { #>       "idx": 2, #>       "why": "conducting classes (bioinformatics basics) for Biotechnology students (Faculty of Chemistry)" #>     }, #>     { #>       "idx": 3, #>       "why": "conducting in silico research__presenting the findings during conferences__developing bioinformatics pipelines__conducting classes (bioinformatics basics)__mentoring undergraduate students" #>     }, #>     { #>       "idx": 4, #>       "why": "manual testing of webservices" #>     } #>   ], #>   "education": [ #>     { #>       "idx": 1, #>       "why": "PhD thesis title: Evolution of dominance and antibacterial drug targets" #>     }, #>     { #>       "idx": 2, #>       "why": "Master thesis title: Inferring potential bubonic plague drug targets from the analysis of predicted protein interactions network of Yersinia pestis KIM" #>     } #>   ] #> }  # defining details with put-code(s) from orcid.org # each put-code refers to the given record from education/employment j_path <- system.file(package = "vitorcid", "json_examples/orcid_0000-0002-7059-6378_why_put-code.json") jsonlite::toJSON(jsonlite::fromJSON(j_path), pretty = TRUE) #> { #>   "employment": [ #>     { #>       "put-code": 21893486, #>       "why": "developing biomedical R packages, especially those related to Next-Generation Sequencing data__developing R/Shiny application for visualization of NGS data__developing R/Shiny application for visualization of dose-response data (technical leader)" #>     }, #>     { #>       "put-code": 21893493, #>       "why": "conducting classes (bioinformatics basics) for Biotechnology students (Faculty of Chemistry)" #>     }, #>     { #>       "put-code": 21893501, #>       "why": "conducting in silico research__presenting the findings during conferences__developing bioinformatics pipelines__conducting classes (bioinformatics basics)__mentoring undergraduate students" #>     }, #>     { #>       "put-code": 21893522, #>       "why": "manual testing of webservices" #>     } #>   ], #>   "education": [ #>     { #>       "put-code": 21893544, #>       "why": "PhD thesis title: Evolution of dominance and antibacterial drug targets" #>     }, #>     { #>       "put-code": 21893532, #>       "why": "Master thesis title: Inferring potential bubonic plague drug targets from the analysis of predicted protein interactions network of Yersinia pestis KIM" #>     } #>   ] #> } vitorcid::get_cv(json_path = j_path)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Arkadiusz Gladki. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gladki (2024). vitorcid: Wrapper Vitae Create CV Data Fetched ORCID Database. R package version 0.0.3.
code: @Manual{,   title = {vitorcid: A Wrapper of Vitae to Create a CV with the Data Fetched from ORCID Database},   author = {Arkadiusz Gladki},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.3}, }

title: extract date — extract_date
text: extract date ORCID section (e.g. employment education summary)

title: extract date — extract_date
text: tbl summary table fetched ORCID tag string summary tag

title: extract date — extract_date
text: character vector start date - end date entris employment education record

title: get CV — get_cv
text: get CV Rmd /PDF file data ORCID

title: get CV — get_cv
code: get_cv(   out_file = file.path(getwd(), "CV"),   orcid = Sys.getenv("ORCID_ID"),   output_type = c("Rmd", "pdf"),   json_path = NULL,   entries = c("education", "employment", "r_package", "citation") )

title: get CV — get_cv
text: out_file string output file orcid string ORCID ID default fetched fomr "ORCID_ID" system variable output_type string output format ('Rmd' 'pdf') json_path string JSON file additional/custom data entries character vector entries included CV

what: get CV data from ORCID — get_cv_data
title: get CV data from ORCID — get_cv_data
text: get CV data ORCID

title: get CV data from ORCID — get_cv_data
code: get_cv_data(   orcid = Sys.getenv("ORCID_ID"),   json_path = NULL,   entries = c("education", "employment", "r_package", "citation") )

title: get CV data from ORCID — get_cv_data
text: orcid string ORCID ID default fetched fomr "ORCID_ID" system variable json_path string JSON file additional/custom data entries character vector entries included CV

text: orcid string ORCID ID default fetched fomr "ORCID_ID" system variable json_path string JSON file additional/custom data output_type string output format ('list' 'yaml' return list YAML header data

title: get JSON data — gjd
text: get data json file, either subset full data

title: get JSON data — gjd
code: gjd(s = NULL, names_only = FALSE, json_path = NULL)

title: get JSON data — gjd
text: s string name first-level JSON entry fetched set NULL (default) data full JSON entry returned names_only logical, TRUE names first-level JSON entries returned json_path string path JSON file

title: get JSON data — gjd
text: R object returned jsonlite::fromJSON
